title: Usage
text: package aims implement simple way methodologies INE Chile, ECLAC 2020 ECLAC 2023 quality assessment estimates household surveys. tutorial shows basic use package includes main functions create necessary inputs implement quality standards.

title: Usage
text: use two datasets: Encuesta Nacional de Empleo (efm 2020) VIII Encuesta de Presupuestos Familiares datasets loaded package can used package loaded session 1. data edition case ENE purpuse creating subpopulations (work force, unemployed unemployed).
code: library(survey) library(calidad) library(dplyr) ene <- ene %>%    mutate(fdt = if_else(cae_especifico >= 1 & cae_especifico <= 9, 1, 0), # labour force          ocupado = if_else(cae_especifico >= 1 & cae_especifico <= 7, 1, 0), # employed          desocupado = if_else(cae_especifico >= 8 & cae_especifico <= 9, 1, 0)) # unemployed  # One row per household epf <- epf_personas %>%    group_by(folio) %>%    slice(1) %>%    ungroup()

title: Usage
text: starting use package, necessary declare sample design survey, use survey package. primary sample unit, stratum weights must declared. also possible use design weights, nevertheless case variance estimated simple random sampling assumption. case declare complex design two surveys (EPF ENE). Additionally, may useful declare option strata one PSU.
code: # Store original options old_options <-  options() # Complex sample design for ENE dc_ene <- svydesign(ids = ~conglomerado , strata = ~estrato_unico, data = ene, weights = ~fact_cal) # Complex sample design for EPF dc_epf <- svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf, weights = ~fe) options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty")

title: Usage
text: assess quality estimate, INE methodology establishes differentiated criteria estimates proportion (ratio), one hand, estimates mean, size total, . case proportion estimation, necessary sample size, degrees freedom standard error. estimates require sample size, degrees freedom, coefficient variation. package includes separate functions create inputs estimates mean, proportion, totals size. following example shows proportion size functions used. var: variable estimated. Must dummy variable domains: required domains. subpop: reference subpopulation. optional works filter (must dummy variable) design: sample design function returns neccesary inputs implement standard get domains, can use “+” symbol follows: useful parameter eclac_input. allows return ECLAC inputs. default parameter FALSE option TRUE can activate .
code: insumos_prop <- create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) # proportion of unemployed people insumos_total <-  create_size(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) # number of unemployed people desagregar <- create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo+region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene) eclac_inputs <-  create_prop(var = "desocupado", domains = "sexo+region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene, eclac_input = TRUE)

title: Usage
text: cases may interest assess quality sum. example, sum income EPF geographical area level (Gran Santiago regional capitals). , create_total function. function receives continuous variable hours, expense, income generates totals requested level. ending “” function alludes fact continuous variable used. want assess estimate mean, function create_mean. case, calculate average expenditure households, according geographical area. default usage disaggregate, case functions used follows:
code: insumos_suma <-  create_total(var = "gastot_hd", domains = "zona", design =  dc_epf) insumos_media <-  create_mean(var = "gastot_hd", domains = "zona", design =  dc_epf) # ENE dataset insumos_prop_nacional <- create_prop("desocupado", subpop = "fdt", design = dc_ene) insumos_total_nacional <-  create_total("desocupado", subpop = "fdt", design = dc_ene) # EPF dataset insumos_suma_nacional <- create_total("gastot_hd", design = dc_epf) insumos_media_nacional <-  create_mean("gastot_hd", design = dc_epf)

title: Usage
text: inputs generated, can assessment. , use assess function. default, apply INE Chile criteria scheme = 'chile'. However, want evaluate using ECLAC criteria, need specify scheme = 'eclac_2020' scheme = 'eclac_2023' output dataframe , addition containing information already generated, includes column indicates whether estimate unreliable, less reliable reliable. function assess parameter allows us know table published . Following criteria standard, 50% estimates table reliable, published.
code: # INE Chile evaluacion_prop <- assess(insumos_prop) evaluacion_tot <- assess(insumos_total) evaluacion_suma <- assess(insumos_suma) evaluacion_media <- assess(insumos_media)  # ECLAC  evaluacion_cepal_2020 <- assess(eclac_inputs, scheme = 'eclac_2020') evaluacion_cepal_2023 <- assess(eclac_inputs, scheme = 'eclac_2023') # Unemployment by region desagregar <- create_size(var = "desocupado", domains = "region", subpop = "fdt", design =  dc_ene)  # assess output evaluacion_tot_desagreg <- assess(desagregar, publish = T) evaluacion_tot_desagreg # Reset original options options(old_options)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Klaus Lehmann. Author, maintainer. Ricardo Pizarro. Author. Ignacio Agloni. Contributor. Andrea López. Contributor. Javiera Preuss. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lehmann K, Pizarro R (2024). calidad: Assesses Quality Estimates Made Complex Sample Designs. R package version 0.5.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {calidad: Assesses the Quality of Estimates Made by Complex Sample Designs},   author = {Klaus Lehmann and Ricardo Pizarro},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.0}, }

what: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
title: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
text: assess evaluates quality mean estimations using methodology created INE Chile, considers sample size, degrees freedom, coefficient variation.

title: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
code: assess(   table,   publish = FALSE,   scheme = c("chile", "eclac_2020", "eclac_2023"),   domain_info = FALSE,   ... )

title: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
text: table dataframe created crear_insumos_media. publish boolean indicating evaluation complete table must added. TRUE, function adds new column dataframe. scheme character variable indicating evaluation protocol use. Options "chile", "eclac_2020", "eclac_2023". domain_info Logical. TRUE, indicates study domain information available used assessment. affects evaluation conducted, leveraging specific domain-level data refine assessment results. FALSE, domain-specific adjustments omitted, generalized assessment performed. ... additional parameters evaluation. complete list parameters : 1. General Parameters df degrees freedom. Default: 9. n sample size. Default chile scheme: 60. Default CEPAL schemes: 100. 2. chile Parameters cv_lower_ine lower limit CV. Default: 0.15. cv_upper_ine upper limit CV. Default: 0.3. 3. CEPAL 2020 Parameters cv_cepal limit CV. Default: 0.2. ess effective sample size. Default: 140. unweighted unweighted count. Default: 50. log_cv logarithmic coefficient variation. Default: 0.175. 4. CEPAL 2023 Parameters cv_lower_cepal lower limit CV. Default: 0.2. cv_upper_cepal upper limit CV. Default: 0.3. ess effective sample size. Default: 60. cvlog_max maximum logarithmic coefficient variation. Default: 0.175. CCNP_b unweighted count adjustment. Default: 50. CCNP_a unweighted count adjustment. Default: 30.

title: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
text: dataframe columns included input table, plus new column containing label indicating evaluation estimation: reliable, bit reliable, unreliable.

title: Assess the quality of mean estimations — assess
code: dc <- survey::svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf_personas, weights = ~fe) assess(create_mean("gastot_hd", domains = "zona+sexo", design = dc)) #>   zona sexo    stat       se  df     n         cv                 eval_n #> 1    1    1 1378016 69421.07 127 12300 0.05037756 sufficient sample size #> 2    2    1 1082227 36324.22 121 10393 0.03356434 sufficient sample size #> 3    1    2 1325015 68510.58 127 13729 0.05170551 sufficient sample size #> 4    2    2 1088658 35343.76 121 11886 0.03246545 sufficient sample size #>         eval_df    eval_cv    label #> 1 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 reliable #> 2 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 reliable #> 3 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 reliable #> 4 sufficient df cv <= 0.15 reliable

code: library(survey) #> Loading required package: grid #> Loading required package: Matrix #> Loading required package: survival #>  #> Attaching package: 'survey' #> The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': #>  #>     dotchart library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  hogar <- epf_personas %>%   group_by(folio) %>%   slice(1) dc <- survey::svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = hogar, weights = ~fe) table <- assess(create_prop("ocupado", domains = "zona+sexo", design = dc))

what: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: create_mean generates dataframe following elements: mean, degrees freedom, sample size, coefficient variation. function allows grouping several domains.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
code: create_mean(   var,   domains = NULL,   subpop = NULL,   design,   ci = FALSE,   ess = FALSE,   ajuste_ene = FALSE,   standard_eval = FALSE,   rm.na = FALSE,   deff = FALSE,   rel_error = FALSE,   unweighted = FALSE,   eclac_input = FALSE )

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: var numeric variable within dataframe. domains domains estimated separated + character. subpop integer dummy variable filter dataframe. design complex design created survey package. ci boolean indicating confidence intervals must calculated. ess boolean effective sample size. ajuste_ene boolean indicating adjustment sampling-frame transition period must used. standard_eval boolean indicating function wrapped inside another function, TRUE avoid lazy eval errors. rm.na boolean remove NA values required. deff boolean design effect. rel_error boolean relative error. unweighted boolean add non-weighted count required. eclac_input boolean return eclac inputs.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean
text: dataframe contains inputs domains evaluated.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of mean estimations — create_mean

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
code: create_prop(   var,   denominator = NULL,   domains = NULL,   subpop = NULL,   design,   ci = FALSE,   deff = FALSE,   ess = FALSE,   ajuste_ene = FALSE,   rel_error = FALSE,   log_cv = FALSE,   unweighted = FALSE,   standard_eval = FALSE,   eclac_input = FALSE )

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
text: var numeric variable within dataframe, numerator ratio calculated. denominator numeric variable within dataframe, denominator ratio calculated. var parameter dummy, can NULL. domains domains estimated separated + character. subpop integer dummy variable filter dataframe. design complex design created survey package. ci boolean indicating confidence intervals must calculated. deff boolean design effect. ess boolean effective sample size. ajuste_ene boolean indicating adjustment sampling-frame transition period must used. rel_error boolean relative error. log_cv boolean logarithmic coefficient variation. unweighted boolean add non-weighted count required. standard_eval boolean indicating function wrapped inside another function, TRUE avoid lazy eval errors. eclac_input boolean return eclac inputs

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
text: dataframe contains inputs domains evaluated.

title: Create the inputs to evaluate the quality of proportion estimations — create_prop
code: library(survey) library(dplyr)  epf <- mutate(epf_personas, gasto_zona1 = if_else(zona == 1, gastot_hd, 0)) dc <- svydesign(ids = ~varunit, strata = ~varstrat, data = epf, weights = ~fe) old_options <- options() options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty")  create_prop(var = "gasto_zona1", denominator = "gastot_hd", design = dc) #>        stat         se  df     n         cv #> 1 0.6138541 0.02485186 248 48308 0.04048496  enusc <- filter(enusc, Kish == 1)  dc <- svydesign(ids = ~Conglomerado, strata = ~VarStrat, data = enusc, weights = ~Fact_Pers) options(survey.lonely.psu = "certainty") create_prop(var = "VP_DC", denominator = "hom_insg_taxi", design = dc) #>        stat         se  df     n         cv #> 1 0.8937474 0.04366055 486 24465 0.04885111 options(old_options)
